00024 #define SERVER_CONNECTION 2

00030 typedef struct _Target
00031 {
00032     char* uri;
00033     char* x;
00034     char* y;
00035     int id;
00036     BOOL new;
00037     BOOL changed;
00038     int removeTask;

00054 void target_setX(Target* target, const char* newValue)
00055 {
00056     if (target->x != NULL)
00057     {
00058         free(target->x);
00059     }
00060     target->x = (char*) malloc(strlen(newValue) + 1);
00061     strcpy(target->x, newValue);
00062 
00063     target->changed = TRUE;
00064 }
00065 
00066 void target_setY(Target* target, const char* newValue)
00067 {
00068     if (target->y != NULL)
00069     {
00070         free(target->y);
00071     }
00072     target->y = (char*) malloc(strlen(newValue) + 1);
00073     strcpy(target->y, newValue);
00074 
00075     target->changed = TRUE;
00076 }
00077 
00078 Target* target_get(int id)
00079 {
00080     int i;
00081     for (i = 0; i < _targetsCount; i++)
00082     {
00083         if (_targets[i].id == id)
00084         {
00085             return &(_targets[i]);
00086         }
00087     }
00088 
00089     // no target with provided id is found
00090     // return empty target
00091     for (i = 0; i < _targetsCount; i++)
00092     {
00093         if (_targets[i].id == 0)
00094         {
00095             _targets[i].id = id;
00096             _targets[i].new = TRUE;
00097             return &(_targets[i]);
00098         }
00099     }
00100 
00101     // no free slots
00102     return NULL;
00103 }
00104 
00105 int target_sendUpdate(Target* target)
00106 {
00107     // send new X and Y values to the server
00108     // generate URI for x coordinate
00109     int error;
00110     int targetUriLength = strlen(target->uri);
00111     char fullUri[targetUriLength + 10];
00112     strcpy(fullUri, target->uri);
00113 
00114     if (target->new == TRUE)
00115     {
00116         // send update of available attribute
00117         strcat(fullUri, "available");
00118 
00119         error = obix_writeValue(SERVER_CONNECTION,
00120                                 _deviceId,
00121                                 fullUri,
00122                                 XML_TRUE,
00123                                 OBIX_T_BOOL);
00124         target->new = FALSE;
00125     }
00126     else if (target->changed == FALSE)
00127     {
00128         // target is being removed
00129         strcat(fullUri, "available");
00130 
00131         error = obix_writeValue(SERVER_CONNECTION,
00132                                 _deviceId,
00133                                 fullUri,
00134                                 XML_FALSE,
00135                                 OBIX_T_BOOL);
00136     }
00137 
00138     // send update of X coordinate
00139     fullUri[targetUriLength] = 'x';
00140     fullUri[targetUriLength + 1] = '\0';
00141 
00142     error = obix_writeValue(SERVER_CONNECTION,
00143                             _deviceId,
00144                             fullUri,
00145                             target->x,
00146                             OBIX_T_REAL);
00147     if (error != OBIX_SUCCESS)
00148     {
00149         return error;
00150     }
00151 
00152     // send Y update
00153     fullUri[targetUriLength] = 'y';
00154     fullUri[targetUriLength + 1] = '\0';
00155 
00156     error = obix_writeValue(SERVER_CONNECTION,
00157                             _deviceId,
00158                             fullUri,
00159                             target->y,
00160                             OBIX_T_REAL);
00161     if (error != OBIX_SUCCESS)
00162     {
00163         return error;
00164     }
00165 
00166     target->changed = FALSE;
00167     return OBIX_SUCCESS;
00168 }
00169 
00170 int parseTarget(IXML_Node* node, int position)
00171 {
00172     node = ixmlNode_getFirstChild(node);
00173     // first node is id tag (at least we hope so :)
00174     const char* attrValue = ixmlElement_getAttribute(
00175                                 ixmlNode_convertToElement(node), OBIX_ATTR_VAL);
00176     int id = atoi(attrValue);
00177     if (id <= 0)
00178     {
00179         char* buffer = ixmlPrintNode(node);
00180         log_error("Unable to parse target: "
00181                   "ID expected in the first child tag, but it is:\n%s",
00182                   buffer);
00183         free(buffer);
00184         return -1;
00185     }
00186     // get corresponding target
00187     Target* target = target_get(id);
00188     if (target == NULL)
00189     {
00190         // there is no free slot to monitor this target - ignore it
00191         return 0;
00192     }
00193 
00194     // iterate through the whole list of target params
00195     while (node != NULL)
00196     {
00197         IXML_Element* param = ixmlNode_convertToElement(node);
00198         if (param == NULL)
00199         {
00200             log_error("Target contains something unexpected.");
00201             return -1;
00202         }
00203 
00204         const char* paramName = ixmlElement_getAttribute(
00205                                     param,
00206                                     OBIX_ATTR_NAME);
00207         if (paramName == NULL)
00208         {
00209             log_error("Target object doesn't have \"%s\" attribute.",
00210                       OBIX_ATTR_NAME);
00211             return -1;
00212         }
00213 
00214         if (strcmp(paramName, "x") == 0)
00215         {
00216             const char* newValue = ixmlElement_getAttribute(param, OBIX_ATTR_VAL);
00217             if (newValue == NULL)
00218             {
00219                 return -1;
00220             }
00221             target_setX(target, newValue);
00222         }
00223         else if (strcmp(paramName, "y") == 0)
00224         {
00225             const char* newValue = ixmlElement_getAttribute(param, OBIX_ATTR_VAL);
00226             if (newValue == NULL)
00227             {
00228                 return -1;
00229             }
00230             target_setY(target, newValue);
00231         }
00232 
00233         node = ixmlNode_getNextSibling(node);
00234     }
00235 
00236     return 0;
00237 }
00238 
00239 void targetRemoveTask(void* arg)
00240 {
00241     Target* target = (Target*) arg;
00242 
00243     pthread_mutex_lock(&_targetMutex);
00244 
00245     if (target->changed == TRUE)
00246     {
00247         // target is updated
00248         // no need to remove it now
00249         pthread_mutex_unlock(&_targetMutex);
00250         return;
00251     }
00252 
00253     // clean target
00254     target->id = 0;
00255     target->new = FALSE;
00256     target->removeTask = 0;
00257     target_setX(target, "0");
00258     target_setY(target, "0");
00259     target->changed = FALSE;
00260 
00261     // send update to the server
00262     if (target_sendUpdate(target) != OBIX_SUCCESS)
00263     {
00264         log_error("Unable to update the target at oBIX server.");
00265     }
00266 
00267     pthread_mutex_unlock(&_targetMutex);
00268 }
00269 
00275 int checkTargets()
00276 {
00277     int i;
00278     for (i = 0; i < _targetsCount; i++)
00279     {
00280         Target* target = &(_targets[i]);
00281         if (target->id == 0)
00282         {
00283             // this is empty target slot - ignore it
00284             continue;
00285         }
00286 
00287         if (target->changed == TRUE)
00288         {
00289             // check whether removing of the task is scheduled
00290             if (target->removeTask != 0)
00291             {
00292                 ptask_cancel(_taskThread, target->removeTask);
00293                 target->removeTask = 0;
00294             }
00295 
00296             // send update to the server
00297             if (target_sendUpdate(target) != OBIX_SUCCESS)
00298             {
00299                 return -1;
00300             }
00301         }
00302         else
00303         {
00304             // schedule target removal
00305             if (target->removeTask == 0)
00306             {
00307                 target->removeTask = ptask_schedule(_taskThread,
00308                                                     &targetRemoveTask,
00309                                                     target,
00310                                                     TARGET_REMOVE_TIMEOUT,
00311                                                     1);
00312             }
00313         }
00314     }
00315 
00316     return 0;
00317 }
00318 
00319 int targetsListener(int connectionId,
00320                     int deviceId,
00321                     int listenerId,
00322                     const char* newValue)
00323 {
00324     //    log_debug("Targets update received:\n%s\n", newValue);
00325     // parse update
00326     IXML_Document* doc;
00327     int error = ixmlParseBufferEx(newValue, &doc);
00328     if (error != IXML_SUCCESS)
00329     {
00330         log_error("Unable to parse received targets update:\n%s", newValue);
00331         return -1;
00332     }
00333 
00334     pthread_mutex_lock(&_targetMutex);
00335     IXML_NodeList* targets = ixmlDocument_getElementsByTagName(doc, OBIX_OBJ);
00336     if (targets == NULL)
00337     {
00338         // no targets - ignore.
00339         ixmlDocument_free(doc);
00340         error = checkTargets();
00341         pthread_mutex_unlock(&_targetMutex);
00342         return error;
00343     }
00344 
00345     int i;
00346     int targetsCount = ixmlNodeList_length(targets);
00347     if (targetsCount > _targetsCount)
00348     {
00349         log_warning("Sensor Floor returned %d targets, "
00350                     "but we monitor only %d.", targetsCount, _targetsCount);
00351         targetsCount = _targetsCount;
00352     }
00353 
00354     for (i = 0; i < targetsCount; i++)
00355     {
00356         if (parseTarget(ixmlNodeList_item(targets, i), i) != 0)
00357         {
00358             // error occurred, stop parsing
00359             log_error("Unable to parse received targets update:\n%s",
00360                       newValue);
00361             break;
00362         }
00363     }
00364 
00365     ixmlNodeList_free(targets);
00366     ixmlDocument_free(doc);
00367 
00368     //check targets and send updates if necessary
00369     checkTargets();
00370     pthread_mutex_unlock(&_targetMutex);
00371 
00372     return 0;
00373 }
00374 
00375 int eventFeedListener(int connectionId,
00376                       int deviceId,
00377                       int listenerId,
00378                       const char* newValue)
00379 {
00380     // parse update
00381     IXML_Document* doc;
00382     int error = ixmlParseBufferEx(newValue, &doc);
00383     if (error != IXML_SUCCESS)
00384     {
00385         log_error("Unable to parse received event feed update:\n%s", newValue);
00386         return -1;
00387     }
00388 
00389     //    if (ixmlDocument_getElementById(doc, OBIX_OBJ) != NULL)
00390     //    {
00391     // TODO change me to log_debug
00392     //    if (strncmp(newValue, "<feed", 5) != 0)
00393     //    {
00394     //        printf("Received new event:\n%s", newValue);
00395     //    }
00396     //    }
00397 
00398     // check whether we have fallen event
00399 
00400     if (ixmlDocument_getElementByAttrValue(doc,
00401                                            OBIX_ATTR_VAL,
00402                                            "FALLEN") != NULL
00403             || ixmlDocument_getElementByAttrValue(doc,
00404                                                   OBIX_ATTR_VAL,
00405                                                   "PULSE") != NULL
00406             || ixmlDocument_getElementByAttrValue(doc,
00407                                                   OBIX_ATTR_VAL,
00408                                                   "NOVITALS") != NULL)
00409     {
00410         // fall event occurred! notify oBIX server
00411         // lock the mutex because we use connection to the server which can
00412         // be used from another thread simultaneously
00413         pthread_mutex_lock(&_targetMutex);
00414         printf("Somebody fell down..\n");
00415         error = obix_writeValue(SERVER_CONNECTION,
00416                                 _deviceId,
00417                                 "fall",
00418                                 XML_TRUE,
00419                                 OBIX_T_BOOL);
00420         if (error != OBIX_SUCCESS)
00421         {
00422             log_error("Unable to notify oBIX server about fall event.");
00423         }
00424         pthread_mutex_unlock(&_targetMutex);
00425     }
00426 
00427     ixmlDocument_free(doc);
00428     return 0;
00429 }
00430 
00431 int loadDeviceData(IXML_Element* deviceConf)
00432 {
00433     if (deviceConf == NULL)
00434     {
00435         return -1;
00436     }
00437 
00438     // get device object stub
00439     IXML_Element* deviceData = config_getChildTag(deviceConf, OBIX_OBJ, TRUE);
00440     if (deviceData == NULL)
00441     {
00442         return -1;
00443     }
00444 
00445     // create a copy of device data
00446     deviceData = ixmlElement_cloneWithLog(deviceData);
00447     IXML_Document* doc = ixmlNode_getOwnerDocument(ixmlElement_getNode(deviceData));
00448 
00449     // get target settings
00450     IXML_Element* target = config_getChildTag(deviceConf, "target", TRUE);
00451     if (target == NULL)
00452     {
00453         ixmlDocument_free(doc);
00454         return -1;
00455     }
00456 
00457     int targetsCount = config_getTagIntAttrValue(target, "count", TRUE, 1);
00458     if (targetsCount <= 0)
00459     {
00460         ixmlDocument_free(doc);
00461         return -1;
00462     }
00463 
00464     _targets = (Target*) calloc(targetsCount, sizeof(Target));
00465     _targetsCount = targetsCount;
00466 
00467     // get target stub
00468     target = config_getChildTag(target, OBIX_OBJ, TRUE);
00469     if (target == NULL)
00470     {
00471         ixmlDocument_free(doc);
00472         return -1;
00473     }
00474 
00475     // generate required amount of targets
00476     int i;
00477     IXML_Node* node;
00478     for (i = 0; i < targetsCount; i++)
00479     {
00480         ixmlDocument_importNode(doc, ixmlElement_getNode(target), TRUE, &node);
00481         ixmlNode_appendChild(ixmlElement_getNode(deviceData), node);
00482 
00483         // generate name and href of the new target
00484         char name[9];
00485         char displayName[10];
00486         char* href = (char*) malloc(10);
00487 
00488         sprintf(name, "target%d", i + 1);
00489         sprintf(displayName, "Target %d", i + 1);
00490         sprintf(href, "target%d/", i + 1);
00491 
00492         IXML_Element* t = ixmlNode_convertToElement(node);
00493         ixmlElement_setAttribute(t, OBIX_ATTR_NAME, name);
00494         ixmlElement_setAttribute(t, OBIX_ATTR_DISPLAY_NAME, displayName);
00495         ixmlElement_setAttribute(t, OBIX_ATTR_HREF, href);
00496         // save target
00497         _targets[i].uri = href;
00498     }
00499 
00500     _deviceData = doc;
00501     return 0;
00502 }
00503 
00504 int loadSettings(const char* fileName)
00505 {
00506     IXML_Element* settings = config_loadFile(fileName);
00507     if (settings == NULL)
00508     {
00509         return -1;
00510     }
00511 
00512     // initialize obix_client library with loaded settings
00513     int error = obix_loadConfig(settings);
00514     if (error != OBIX_SUCCESS)
00515     {
00516         config_finishInit(FALSE);
00517         return error;
00518     }
00519 
00520     // load data which will be posted to oBIX server from settings file
00521     IXML_Element* element = config_getChildTag(settings, "device-info", TRUE);
00522     if (loadDeviceData(element) != 0)
00523     {
00524         return -1;
00525     }
00526 
00527     // TODO remove me
00528     // load test data
00529     element = config_getChildTag(settings, "test-data", TRUE);
00530     element = ixmlElement_cloneWithLog(element);
00531     _testData = ixmlNode_getOwnerDocument(ixmlElement_getNode(element));
00532 
00533     // finish initialization
00534     config_finishInit(TRUE);
00535     return 0;
00536 }

00538 void testCycle()
00539 {
00540     IXML_NodeList* testList = ixmlDocument_getElementsByTagName(_testData, "list");
00541     int testCount = ixmlNodeList_length(testList);
00542 
00543     int i;
00544     for (i = 0; i < testCount; i++)
00545     {
00546         printf("Test step #%d from %d. Press Enter to continue.\n", i, testCount);
00547         getchar();
00548 
00549         char* testData = ixmlPrintNode(ixmlNodeList_item(testList, i));
00550         targetsListener(SENSOR_FLOOR_CONNECTION, 0, 0, testData);
00551         free(testData);
00552     }
00553 
00554     ixmlNodeList_free(testList);
00555     ixmlDocument_free(_testData);
00556 }

00562 void resetTargets()
00563 {
00564     int i;
00565     for (i = 0; i < _targetsCount; i++)
00566     {
00567         if (_targets[i].id != 0)
00568         {
00569             targetRemoveTask(&(_targets[i]));
00570         }
00571 
00572         free(_targets[i].x);
00573         free(_targets[i].y);
00574         free(_targets[i].uri);
00575     }
00576 
00577     free(_targets);
00578 }

00580 // TODO this task checks last floor event and sends it to
00581 void checkEventsTask(void* args)
00582 {
00583     static BOOL receivedEvent;
00584     int error = curl_ext_get(_curl_handle, "http://195.156.198.23/obix/elsi/Stok/event/");
00585     if (error != 0)
00586     {
00587         log_error("Unable to read last floor event.");
00588     }
00589 
00590     if ((strstr(_curl_handle->inputBuffer, "FALLEN") != NULL) ||
00591             (strstr(_curl_handle->inputBuffer, "PULSE") != NULL) ||
00592             (strstr(_curl_handle->inputBuffer, "NOVITALS") != NULL))
00593     {
00594         if (receivedEvent == FALSE)
00595         {
00596             receivedEvent = TRUE;
00597             eventFeedListener(SENSOR_FLOOR_FEED_CONNECTION, 0, 0, _curl_handle->inputBuffer);
00598         }
00599     }
00600     else
00601     {
00602         receivedEvent = FALSE;
00603     }
00604 }

00606 int main(int argc, char** argv)
00607 {
00608     if (argc != 2)
00609     {
00610         printf("Usage: sensor_floor_driver <config_file>\n"
00611                " where <config_file> - Address of the configuration file.\n");
00612         return -1;
00613     }
00614 
00615     // load settings from file
00616     if (loadSettings(argv[1]) != 0)
00617     {
00618         log_error("Unable to load settings from file %s.\n", argv[1]);
00619         return -1;
00620     }
00621 
00622     // initialize the task thread
00623     _taskThread = ptask_init();
00624     if (_taskThread == NULL)
00625     {
00626         log_error("Unable to initialize separate thread.");
00627     }
00628 
00629     // open connection to the Sensor Floor
00630     int error = obix_openConnection(SENSOR_FLOOR_CONNECTION);
00631     if (error != OBIX_SUCCESS)
00632     {
00633         log_error("Unable to establish connection with the Sensor Floor.\n");
00634         return error;
00635     }
00636 
00637     // open second connection to the Sensor Floor (for events)
00638     error = obix_openConnection(SENSOR_FLOOR_FEED_CONNECTION);
00639     if (error != OBIX_SUCCESS)
00640     {
00641         log_error("Unable to establish second connection with the Sensor "
00642                   "Floor.\n");
00643         return error;
00644     }
00645 
00646     // open connection to oBIX server
00647     error = obix_openConnection(SERVER_CONNECTION);
00648     if (error != OBIX_SUCCESS)
00649     {
00650         log_error("Unable to establish connection with oBIX server.\n");
00651         return error;
00652     }
00653 
00654     // register Sensor Floor at oBIX server
00655     char* deviceData = ixmlPrintDocument(_deviceData);
00656     _deviceId = obix_registerDevice(SERVER_CONNECTION, deviceData);
00657     free(deviceData);
00658     if (_deviceId < 0)
00659     {
00660         log_error("Unable to register Sensor Floor at oBIX server.\n");
00661         return -1;
00662     }
00663 
00664     // register listener for targets list of the Sensor Floor
00665 //    int targetListenerId = obix_registerListener(SENSOR_FLOOR_CONNECTION,
00666 //                           0,
00667 //                           "/obix/elsi/Stok/targets/",
00668 //                           &targetsListener);
00669 //    if (targetListenerId < 0)
00670 //    {
00671 //        log_error("Unable to register update listener for targets.\n");
00672 //        return targetListenerId;
00673 //    }
00674 
00675     // register listener of event feed
00676     int feedListenerId = obix_registerListener(SENSOR_FLOOR_FEED_CONNECTION,
00677                          0,
00678                          "/obix/elsi/Stok/eventFeed/",
00679                          &eventFeedListener);
00680     if (feedListenerId < 0)
00681     {
00682         printf("Unable to register update listener for event feed.\n");
00683         return feedListenerId;
00684     }
00685 
00686     // TODO workaround for catching FALLEN event
00687     curl_ext_create(&_curl_handle);
00688     int taskId = ptask_schedule(_taskThread,
00689                                 &checkEventsTask,
00690                                 NULL,
00691                                 LAST_EVENT_POOL_PERIOD,
00692                                 EXECUTE_INDEFINITE);
00693 
00694 
00695         testCycle();
00696 
00697     printf("Sensor Floor is successfully registered at the oBIX server\n\n"
00698            "Press Enter to stop driver...\n");
00699     // wait for user input
00700     getchar();
00701 
00702     // remove targets listener (it is automatically done by calling
00703     // obix_dispose(), but we want to reset target values at the server before
00704     // exiting, and we need to stop updating values before this
00705 //    obix_unregisterListener(SERVER_CONNECTION, _deviceId, feedListenerId);
00706 
00707     // reset and free all targets
00708     resetTargets();
00709 
00710     // release all resources allocated by oBIX client library.
00711     // No need to close connection or unregister listener explicitly - it is
00712     // done automatically.
00713     obix_dispose();
00714     ixmlDocument_free(_deviceData);
00715 
00716     ptask_cancel(_taskThread, taskId);
00717     ptask_dispose(_taskThread);
00718 
00719     return 0;
00720 }
